result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: For each $500 paid toward restitution during 60 day report period, 10 days will be stayed up to a maximum of 80 days. Defendant must serve at least 20 days. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul M Moore

Defendant Paul M Moore in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers will be representing defendant. Defense requests a status in 30 days. State requests cash bond with conditions. Bond set. Status 4/04/16 at 11:45 am.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears by phone.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reetz makes oral motion to withdraw from the case. Defendant has no objection. Court grants request. Court reviews events in file. Defendant requests time to talk to PD to get counsel appointed. Atty Gerbers also present in court, indicates he has to go down to the jail later today, will talk to defendant. Court will recall case later this afternoon.

Attorney Brett E Reetz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Reetz indicates his office advised defendant of todays hearing. Defendant indicated to Atty Reetz that he had to work. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant. Atty Reetz anticipates filling a motion to withdraw in both cases.

Defendant Paul M Moore in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks State to extend their offer 6 weeks and set matter for a plea. State has no objection, as long as it's going to be a plea. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Paul M Moore in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz not ready to proceed under the authorization, would like another date 30 days out to give him some time to discuss case with DA Pelrine.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Paul M Moore in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests more time to retain an attorney. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
